metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Sentinel is setup
Appended to workbook displayNames to make them unique
Unique id for the scheduled alert rule
Unique id for the alert rule action
Username to connect to IronNet IronDefense API
Password to connect to IronNet IronDefense API

properties.description: Creates incidents based on behavioral detections from IronDefense.
properties.query:
CommonSecurityLog
  | where DeviceProduct == "IronDefense"
  | summarize arg_max(TimeGenerated, *) by DeviceCustomString4, DeviceCustomString2
  | extend Category = extract(@'cat=([^;]+)(\;|$)', 1, AdditionalExtensions)
  | extend subcat = extract(@'subcat=([^;]+)(\;|$)', 1, AdditionalExtensions) 
  | extend Subcategory = iff(isempty(subcat), Activity, subcat)
  | extend AlertDescription = strcat(Category, ': ', Subcategory)
  | extend Status = tostring(DeviceCustomString2)
  | extend IronVueUrl = replace(@'\\', @'', tostring(DeviceCustomString3))

alertDetailsOverride.alertDescriptionFormat: IronDefense detected suspicious activity on {{TimeGenerated}} and categorized it as "{{AlertDescription}}".  View full details in IronVue: {{IronVueUrl}}

Incidents_were_modified.inputs: Following one or more incidents were modified between @{variables('Interval Frequency')} to @{utcNow()}: @{variables('Incidents')}

No_Incidents_modified.inputs: No Incidents modified between @{variables('Interval Frequency')} to @{utcNow()}

variables.name: Next Link
variables.value: https://@{parameters('AzureManagementEndpoint')}/@{parameters('ResourceGroupId')}/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/@{parameters('workspace_name')}/providers/Microsoft.SecurityInsights/incidents?api-version=2020-01-01&$orderby=properties/lastModifiedTimeUtc desc&$filter=(properties/lastModifiedTimeUtc ne properties/createdTimeUtc) and (properties/lastModifiedTimeUtc le @{utcNow()})  and (properties/lastModifiedTimeUtc gt @{variables('Interval Frequency')})

body.comment: Incident was classified as "@{items('Loop_through_each_Incident')?['properties']?['classification']}: @{items('Loop_through_each_Incident')?['properties']?['classificationReason']}" in Azure Sentinel.
The Incident has been modified in Azure Sentinel. [@{items('Loop_through_each_Incident')?['properties']?['incidentUrl']}]

greater: @sub(variables('Ticks since incident update'), variables('Ticks since last IronDefense Alert'))

classification.ClassificationReasonText: This incident was closed in IronVue. View more details at @{variables('vueUrl')}.

body.message: This incident was modified in IronVue. The status was updated from "@{items('For_each_Sentinel_Incident')?['properties']?['status']}" to "@{variables('Status')}". View more details at @{variables('vueUrl')}.

inputs.name: Message
inputs.value: No Comments available for Alert @{variables('IronNet Alert Id')}

inputs.name: Message
inputs.value: No Sentinel Incidents present for the alert

inputs.name: Message
inputs.value: This is an Event belonging to Alert @{variables('IronNet Alert Id')}

connectorUiConfig.title: IronNet IronDefense
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The IronNet IronDefense connector enables ingest of IronDefense alerts, events, and IronDome notifications into Sentinel, enabling Sentinel to utilize IronDefense's behavioral analytics and the IronDome community to quickly identify threats in your enterprise network.

sampleQueries.query:
CommonSecurityLog 
| where DeviceVendor == "IronNet" and DeviceProduct == "IronDefense" and EventType == 1 | limit 10

CommonSecurityLog 
| where DeviceVendor == "IronNet" and DeviceProduct == "IronDefense" and EventType == 0 | limit 10

CommonSecurityLog 
| where DeviceVendor == "IronNet" and DeviceProduct == "IronDome" | limit 10

dataTypes.name: CommonSecurityLog (IronNet)
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
CommonSecurityLog
| where DeviceVendor == "IronNet"
| summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
| where isnotempty(Time)

value:
CommonSecurityLog
| where DeviceVendor == "IronNet"
| summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
| project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: read and write permissions are required.

read permissions to shared keys for the workspace are required. [See the documentation to learn more about workspace keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/platform/agent-windows#obtain-workspace-id-and-key).

instructionSteps.description:
Install and configure the Linux agent to collect your Common Event Format (CEF) Syslog messages and forward them to Azure Sentinel.

> Notice that the data from all regions will be stored in the selected workspace

innerSteps.title: 1.1 Select or create a Linux machine
innerSteps.description: Select or create a Linux machine that Azure Sentinel will use as the proxy between your security solution and Azure Sentinel this machine can be on your on-prem environment, Azure or other clouds.

innerSteps.title: 1.2 Install the CEF collector on the Linux machine
innerSteps.description:
Install the Microsoft Monitoring Agent on your Linux machine and configure the machine to listen on the necessary port and forward messages to your Azure Sentinel workspace. The CEF collector collects CEF messages on port 514 TCP.

> 1. Make sure that you have Python on your machine using the following command: python -version.

> 2. You must have elevated permissions (sudo) on your machine.

parameters.label: Run the following command to install and apply the CEF collector:

instructionSteps.title: 1. Linux Syslog agent configuration

instructionSteps.description: Configure the IronNet Data Collector to send alerts, events, and IronDome notifications in CEF format to the proxy machine. Make sure you to send the logs to port 514 TCP on the machine's IP address.

innerSteps.title: 2.1 Deploy the IronNet Data Collector VM
innerSteps.description: Deploy the IronNet Data Collector VM using the image provided by your IronNet representative.

innerSteps.title: 2.2 Configure the IronAPI connector using the Data Collector wizard.
innerSteps.description:
Ssh into the Data Collector VM as the config user and use the Data Collector configuration wizard to configure the IronAPI connector to receive notifications from IronDefense and forward them to your Azure Sentinel workspace. You will need:

> 1. IronAPI credentials.

> 2. IronDefense hostname.

> 3. The public IP of the linux machine running the CEF collector.

parameters.label: Run the following command to launch the Data Collector configuration wizard:

innerSteps.title: 2.2 Verify IronAPI connector configuration
innerSteps.description: Verify the IronAPI connector has been configured properly and is running normally.

parameters.label: Run the following command to view the logs in the IronAPI connector. If no errors occur after 5 minutes, the connector is running normally.

instructionSteps.title: 2. Forward Common Event Format (CEF) logs to Syslog agent

instructionSteps.description:
Follow the instructions to validate your connectivity:

Open Log Analytics to check if the logs are received using the CommonSecurityLog schema.

>It may take about 20 minutes until the connection streams data to your workspace.

If the logs are not received, run the following connectivity validation script:

> 1. Make sure that you have Python on your machine using the following command: python -version

>2. You must have elevated permissions (sudo) on your machine

parameters.label: Run the following command to validate your connectivity:

instructionSteps.title: 3. Validate connection

instructionSteps.description:
Make sure to configure the machine's security according to your organization's security policy


[Learn more >](https://aka.ms/SecureCEF)
instructionSteps.title: 4. Secure your machine
